subject: Automobile Racing
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: The National Stock Car Racing Commission, Nascar’s rules appeal body, overturned probation penalties for Tony Stewart and Joey Logano, drivers for Joe Gibbs Racing, in the league’s second-tier Nationwide Series. The commission “unanimously decided to amend the penalties assessed by Nascar, removing the probation portions of both driver penalties,” it said in a statement. The drivers were docked 150 points in the Nationwide standings after postrace inspections at Michigan International Speedway last month. That part of the penalty will stand, the commission said.
